definitions.definition: To be or remain suspended .
examples: The lights hung from the ceiling.

definitions.definition: To float , as if suspended.
examples: The smoke hung in the room.

definitions.definition: To veer in one direction.
To rebound unexpectedly or unusually slowly, due to backward spin on the ball or imperfections of the ground.
definitions.label_groups: intransitive , of a ball in cricket, tennis, etc.

definitions.definition: To hold or bear in a suspended or inclined manner or position instead of erect.
examples: He hung his head in shame.

definitions.definition: To cause (something) to be suspended, as from a hook , hanger , hinges , or the like.
examples: Hang those lights from the ceiling.

definitions.definition: To kill (someone) by suspension from the neck, usually as a form of execution or suicide .
examples: The culprits were hanged from the nearest tree.

definitions.definition: To be executed by suspension by one's neck from a gallows , a tree , or other raised bar, attached by a rope tied into a noose .
examples: You will hang for this, my friend.

definitions.definition: To damn .
To loiter ; to hang around ; to spend time idly.
examples: I didn't see anything, officer. I was just hanging .

definitions.definition: To exhibit (an object) by hanging.
To apply (wallpaper or drywall to a wall).
examples: Let's hang this cute animal design in the nursery.

definitions.definition: To decorate (something) with hanging objects.
examples: Let's hang the nursery with some new wallpaper.

definitions.definition: To remain persistently in one's thoughts.
To prevent from reaching a decision, especially by refusing to join in a verdict that must be unanimous.
examples: One obstinate juror can hang a jury.

definitions.definition: To stop responding to manual input devices such as the keyboard and mouse .
examples: The computer has hung again. Not even pressing <Ctrl>+<Alt>+<Del> works.
When I push this button the program hangs .

definitions.definition: To cause (a program or computer) to stop responding .
examples: The program has a bug that can hang the system.

definitions.definition: To cause ( a piece ) to become vulnerable to capture .
examples: If you move there, you'll hang your rook.

definitions.definition: To be vulnerable to capture .
examples: In this standard opening position White has to be careful because the pawn on e4 hangs .

definitions.definition: To throw a hittable off-speed pitch .
definitions.label_groups: transitive , baseball , slang , of a pitcher

definitions.definition: To attach or cause to stick (a charge or accusation, etc.).

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To be or remain suspended .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To float , as if suspended.
( intransitive ) To veer in one direction.
( intransitive , of a ball in cricket, tennis, etc. ) To rebound unexpectedly or unusually slowly, due to backward spin on the ball or imperfections of the ground.
( transitive ) To hold or bear in a suspended or inclined manner or position instead of erect.
( transitive ) To cause (something) to be suspended, as from a hook , hanger , hinges , or the like.
( transitive , law ) To kill (someone) by suspension from the neck, usually as a form of execution or suicide .
( intransitive , law ) To be executed by suspension by one's neck from a gallows , a tree , or other raised bar, attached by a rope tied into a noose .
( transitive , informal ) (used in maledictions) To damn .
( intransitive , informal ) To loiter ; to hang around ; to spend time idly.
( transitive ) To exhibit (an object) by hanging.
( transitive ) To apply (wallpaper or drywall to a wall).
( transitive ) To decorate (something) with hanging objects.
( intransitive , figuratively ) To remain persistently in one's thoughts.
( transitive ) To prevent from reaching a decision, especially by refusing to join in a verdict that must be unanimous.
( intransitive , computing ) To stop responding to manual input devices such as the keyboard and mouse .
( transitive , computing ) To cause (a program or computer) to stop responding .
( transitive , chess ) To cause ( a piece ) to become vulnerable to capture .
( intransitive , chess ) To be vulnerable to capture .
( transitive , baseball , slang , of a pitcher ) To throw a hittable off-speed pitch .
( transitive , figurative ) To attach or cause to stick (a charge or accusation, etc.).
